column2: Welcome, adventurer, to Mount and Blade: With Fire and Sword. Before beginning your journey, you must create your character and set the game's difficulty.
Character Renown: {reg5}^Honor Rating: {reg6}^Party Morale: {reg8}^Party Size Limit: {reg7}^
The battle has ended. {s1} Your side killed {reg5} enemies and lost {reg6} troops. You personally slew {reg7} men in the battle.
So what nation do you hail from? And what of your family?
My father and mother are of noble gentry.
{s10}^^ You began learning of the world almost as soon as you could walk and talk. You spent your early years as...
A page at a nobleman's court.
{s11}^^ Then, as a young adult, life changed, as it always does. You became...
{s12}^^But soon everything changed and you decided to strike out on your own as an adventurer. Driving you to this decision was...
The loss of a loved one.
Being forced out of your home.
You spot a battle-ready men in the distance.
Increase last offensive time by 24 hours.
You set up camp. What do you wish to do?
Send a messenger to the mayor's aide.
Recruit some of your prisoners to your party.
You offer your prisoners freedom if they agree to join you as soldiers. {s18}
You have no prisoners to recruit.
The decision is made, and you resolve to give up your adventurer's life and settle down. You sell off your weapons and armor, gather up all your money, and ride off into the sunset....
You encounter a herd of cattle.
Bring the herd to a stop.
How many animals do you want to slaughter?
You and your opponent prepare for combat.
{s2} You have {reg10} troops fit for battle against their {reg11}. ^{s4}
Order your troops to attack without you.
Pull back, leaving some soldiers behind to cover your retreat.

As the party member with the highest understanding of tactics, ({reg2} tactics skill), {reg3?you devise:{s3} devises} a plan that will allow you and your men to escape with your lives. However, you'll have to leave {reg4} soldiers behind to stop the enemy from giving chase.
Sacrifice these men to save the rest.
You tell {reg4} of your troops to hold back the enemy, while you retreat with the rest of your party.
Your troops prepare to attack the enemy.
Order your soldiers to continue the attack.
You arrive at a field where you see a battle raging between {s2} and {s1}. Whom shall you support?
Have a word with the attackers.
You ally with {s2} against {s1}, who prepare to attack you. You have {reg10} troops fit for battle, against the enemy's {reg11}.
Order your troops to attack with your allies while you stay back.
You enter the town of Zendar.
You arrive at the Four Ways Inn.
Pass through the siege lines and enter {s1}.
The besiegers allow you to approach the gates without challenge.
{s1} remains under siege. The banners of {s2} fly above the camp of the besiegers, where you and your men are welcomed.
Request a meeting with the commander.
Order your soldiers to join the next assault without you.
Approach the gates and hail the guard.
Disguise yourself and try to sneak into the town.
You approach the gate. The men on the walls watch you closely.
After a brief wait, the guards open the gates, and allow your party inside.
The lord of this fortress has forbidden you from entering these walls, and the guard sergeant informs you that his men will fire if you attempt to come any closer.
With whom do you want to meet?
Your request for a meeting is relayed inside, and finally {s6} appears in the courtyard to speak with you.
Prepare ladders to attack the walls.
Call for a meeting with the fortress commander.
Attempt to break into the city.
Demolish the wall using an explosive.
Lead your soldiers in an assault.
Order your soldiers to attack while you stay back...
The defenders come forth to meet your assault.
You estimate that it will take {reg4} hours to build enough scaling ladders for the assault.
As the best engineer in the party ({reg2} Engineering skill), {reg3?you estimate:{s3} estimates} that building a siege tower will take {reg4} hours.
{s3} has fallen to your troops. You now have full control of the {reg2?town:fortress}. {reg1? It would seem that there is nothing stopping you from taking it for yourself...:}
{s3} has fallen to your troops. You now have full control of the location. Your troops celebrate the victory.
Request that {s3} be awarded to you.

You receive a message from {s3}.^^ {reg4?She:He} has decided to grant {s2}{reg3? and the nearby village of {s4}:} to you, with all due incomes and titles, to hold in {reg4?her:his} name for as long as you maintain your oath of homage.

You receive a message from {s3}.^^ 'I was most pleased to hear of your valiant efforts in the capture of {s2}. Your victory has gladdened all our hearts. You also requested that I give you ownership of the fortress, but that is a favor which I fear I cannot grant, as you already hold significant estates in my realm. Instead I have sent you {reg6} thaler to cover the expenses of your campaign, but {s2} I give to {s5}.'
You have been wronged! Renounce you oath to this sovereign!

Renouncing your oath is a grave act. Your lord may condemn you, and confiscate your lands and holdings. However, if you relinquish them of your own free will, he may let the betrayal stand without a fight.
Renounce your oath and give up your holdings.
Renounce your oath and hold on to your lands, including {s2}.
Remain loyal and accept the decision.
Your lord offers to extend your fiefs! {s1} sends word that he is willing to grant {s2} to you in payment for your loyal service, adding it to your holdings. What will be your answer?
Reject it. You have no interest in {s2}.

With a brief ceremony, you are officially confirmed as the new lord of {s2}{reg3? and its neighboring village {s4}:}. You can now claim rents and revenues from your personal estates there, draft soldiers from the populace, and manage the lands as you see fit. However, you will also be expected to defend your fief and its people from harm, as well as maintaining the rule of law and order.
You had a contract with {s1} to serve him for a certain period of time. This contract has now expired. What will you do?
Renew your contract with {s1} for another month.
{s1} is launching an assault against the walls of {s2}. You have {reg10} troops fit for battle against the enemy's {reg11}. What will be your decision?
Order your men to join the battle without you.
As you approach, you are spotted by the castle guards, who welcome you and open the gates wide before their {lord/lady}.
Go to the center of the village...
Force the peasants to give you supplies.

A heavy blow sends you to the ground, and your vision spins and goes dark. Time passes. When you open your eyes once more, you find yourself battered and bloody, but luckily none of your wounds appear to be lethal.

In a battle worthy of song, you and your men drive the bandits from the village, making it safe once more. The villagers have little left in the way of wealth after their terrifying ordeal, but they offer you all they can find.
Take it as your just due.
Refuse, stating that they need these items more than you do.
{s19}^{reg6?^^You are currently building {s7}. The building will be completed in {reg8} day{reg9?s:}.:}
{s19} As the best engineer in the party ({reg2} Engineering skill), {reg3?you reckon:{s3} reckons} that building the {s4} will cost you {reg5} thaler and will take {reg6} days.

The bandits fall before you as wheat to the scythe! Soon you stand alone in the streets, while most of your attackers lie unconscious, dead or dying. Searching the bodies, you find a purse which must have belonged to a previous victim of these brutes. Or perhaps it was given to them by someone who wanted to arrange a suitable ending to your life...
As the best looter in the party ({reg2} looting skill), {reg3?you reckon:{s1} reckons} that you can steal as many as {reg4} heads of village's cattle.
It will be difficult to force and threaten the peasants into giving up their precious supplies. You think it will take at least one hour.
The villagers grudgingly bring some items.
Some of the angry villagers grab their tools and prepare to resist you. It looks like you'll have a fight on your hands.
The villagers here are few and frightened, and they quickly scatter and run before you. The village is at your mercy.

On your orders, your troops sack the village, pillaging everything of any value, and putting the buildings to torch. From the coins and valuables that are found, you receive your share of {reg1} thaler.
Fighting with courage and determination, the villagers manage to hold together and drive off your forces.
You receive the accumulated rents and taxes of this fief, amounting to {reg1} thaler.
Take a walk around the streets.
Take a walk around the courtyard.
You have been eliminated from the tournament.
You have won the tournament of {s3}! You are filled with pride as the crowd cheers your name. In addition to honor, fame and glory, you earn a prize of {reg9} thaler. {s8}
As the only {reg3?fighter:man} to remain undefeated this day, {s1} wins the lists and the glory of the tournament.
{s1}You are at tier {reg0} of the tournament, with {reg1} participants remaining. In the next round, there will be {reg2} teams with {reg3} {reg4?fighters:fighter} each.
Are you sure you want to withdraw from the tournament?
No, not so long as there is a chance of victory!
The odds against you are {reg5} to {reg6}.{reg1? You have already bet {reg1} thaler on yourself, and if you win, you will earn {reg2}.:} How much do you want to bet?
If you bet {reg1} thaler, you will earn {reg2} thaler if you win the tournament. Is that as you wish?
You ask one of the criers for the names of the tournament participants. They are:^{s11}
As the best trader in the party ({reg2} trade skill), {reg3?you expect:{s1} expects} that collecting taxes here will require {reg4} days...
You've collected {reg3} thaler in taxes from {s3}. You are to bring the collected amount to {s19}.
Your swift action and strong arm have successfully put down the revolt. Surely now anyone with a mind to rebel against you will think better of it.
You could collect only {reg3} thaler as tax from {s3} before revolt broke out. {s1} won't be happy, but some silver is better than none at all...
The people of {s3} are outraged at your demands, and decry it as nothing more than extortion. They're becoming very restless, and they may react violently if you continue pressing them.
Agree to reduce your collection by half. ({s1} may be upset)

You are interrupted while collecting the taxes at {s3}. A large band of angry {reg9?peasants:townsmen} is marching nearer, shouting about the exorbitant taxes, and waving torches and weapons. It looks as though they aim to fight!
As the best instructor in the party ({reg2} training skill), {reg3?you expect:{s1} expects} that getting some peasants ready for practice will take {reg4} hours.

You put the peasants through the basics of soldiering, discipline, and obedience. You believe that {reg0} of them {reg1?have:has} fully grasped the training, while {reg1?are:is} ready for some practice.

As you were training the militia, a man from the village runs up to you, shouting in alarm. The bandits have been spotted on the horizon, riding hard for {s3}. The elder begs that you organize your newly-trained militia and face them.

The bandits are broken! The few who remain run off with their tails between their legs, terrified by the peasants and their new champion. The villagers have little left in the way of wealth after their ordeal, but they offer you all they can find to show their gratitude.
Town Name: {s1}^Rent Income: {reg1} thaler^Tariff Income: {reg2} thaler^Food Stock: enough for {reg3} days
You overhear discussions about the price of trade goods across the area, hoping to work out the best deals.
As the best trader in the party ({reg2} trade skill), {reg3?you try to figure out:{s1} tries to figure out} the best goods to trade in. {s2}
Disguised in the garments of a poor pilgrim, you trick the guards and make your way into town.
As you attempt to sneak in, one of the guards recognizes you and raises the alarm! You must flee back through the gates before all the guards in the town come down on you!
Try to fight your way out!
You drive off the guards and cover your trail as you escape, easily losing your pursuers in the maze of streets.
You make your way back through the gates, quickly retreating to the safety of the hills.
{s2} offers you a sum of {reg12} thaler in silver if you are willing to sell him {s1}.
You approach a mercenary camp... Here you can hire warriors and arm your men.
How many opponents will you battle?
What kind of weapon do you wish to train with?
What kind of ranged weapon do you wish to train with?
At what range do you wish to practice?
{s15} will soon select a new marshal for {s23}. Some of the grandees have put forth your name as likely candidate.
Come forward as a candidate for elections.
Tell everyone that you are too busy for such matters.

Suddenly all the world goes black. Many hours later, you regain consciousness and find yourself at the very spot you fell. Your enemies must have taken you up for dead and left you there. However, it seems that none of your wounds were lethal, and although your head is still reeling, you discover that you can still walk. You pick yourself up and go to look for any other survivors from your party.
After several painful days of being dragged about as a prisoner, you find a chance and escape from your captors!
You are quickly surrounded by guards who take away your weapons. With curses and insults, they throw you into the dungeon where you shall while away the miserable days of your captivity.
You remain in disguise for as long as possible before your ruse is discovered. The guards are outraged, and beat you savagely before throwing you back into the cell for God knows how long...
After many days of imprisonment, you are finally set free when your captors exchange you for another prisoner.

You many spend long hours in the sunless dank of the dungeon, more than you can possibly count. Then, suddenly, one of your captors enters your cell with an offer; he proposes to free you in return for {reg5} thaler of your hidden wealth. You decide to...
Refuse him, and wait for another chance to escape.
More days pass in the darkness of your cell. You survive them as best you can, enduring the kicks and curses of the guards, watching your underfed body waste away more and more...

{s8} sends word that he wishes you to join his military campaign. You must bring with you at least {reg13} troops, and if you do not yet have enough, you are instructed to raise a sufficient force with all due haste.
{s8} sends word that he wishes to speak with you about a task he needs performed. He requests you come to him as soon as possible.
{s8} sends word that you are to join the siege of {s9} in preparation for a full assault. Your troops are to take {s9} at all costs.
You have disobeyed your orders, and failed to follow {s8}. In anger, he has barred you from the army, and sends a stern warning that your actions will not be forgotten.

You receive an offer of service!^^ {s8} of {s9} has sent a messenger to deliver an initiation written in his own hand. You would be granted the honor of becoming a subject of the {lord/lady} of {s9}, and in return, {s8} asks that you swear an oath of homage to him, and fight in his military campaigns. Although he offers you no lands or titles, he will nevertheless surely be offended if you do not accept his offer...

You receive an offer of service!^^ {s8} of {s9} has sent a messenger to deliver an initiation written in his own hand. You are to receive the honor of becoming a subject of the {lord/lady} of {s9}, and in return, {s8} asks that you swear an oath of homage to him, and fight in his military campaigns. He offers you the fief of {s2} for your loyal service, and will surely be offended if you do not accept the offer...
In order to become a vassal, you must swear an oath of homage to {s3}. You shall have to find him and give him your oath in person. {s5}
You receive a Peace Offering^^{s1} offers you a peace agreement. What is your answer?

You now possess land in your name without being tied to any nation. You are a warlord with no master, who knows no higher authority. Enjoy this freedom! -- But know that the kings of the lands will not look kindly upon you, will make every attempt to dispose of you. You may find life very difficult without the protection of a sovereign.
You no longer hold any land.
Enemies have laid waste to a fief^^{s1} has been raided by {s2} of {s3}!
Your village is under attack!^^{s2} of {s3} is laying waste to {s1}.
All of eastern Europe is conquered^^{s1} has defeated all rivals, and stands as the sole sovereign.
Your motherland is defeated^^You won the battle against {s1}! Thus ends the struggle which began after you renounced your oath to them.
An estate is lost.^^You have lost {s1} to {s2}.
Good news!^^ {s1} has left {s2} and joined {s3}.
Declaration of War!^^{s1} has declared war against {s2}!
Peace Agreement!^^{s1} and {s2} have made peace!
Rebellion Success!^^ Your rebellion is victorious! Your nation now has the sole claim to the title of {s11}, with {s12} as the single ruler.
You spot your victim and follow him, watching as he turns a corner. This will surely be your best opportunity to attack him.
Welcome, adventurer, to Mount&Blade. Before you can begin playing the game you must create a character. First, select your character's gender.
What distance do you want to shoot from?
You were defeated in the fight with the priest, and he ordered the guards to jail you.
You managed to overcome the priest and seize the icon. The time has come to flee the city.
You have arrived in time! The Swedes have not yet plundered the monastery. Time to teach them the lesson of Kirchholm once more!
You ask the soldiers at the camp where you may find their commander, and they point out the captain.
Talk to the captain of the Tatar mercenaries.
Talk to the captain of the Cossack mercenaries.
Talk to the captain of the Polish mercenaries.
Talk to the captain of the Swedish mercenaries.
Talk to the captain of the Muscovite mercenaries.
Just as your truce envoy entered the gates with a white flag, you heard a shot -- and then saw his body being hung on the wall.^^The morale of your troops has fallen.
You managed to bribe one of the fortress defenders. He has opened the gates, and now you can unleash carnage on the town.
You managed to sneak into the city and poison the well.
Failure! You were discovered and captured!
You were discovered, but you managed to flee.
You were discovered, but you managed to poison the water. Now you shall have to make your way through the lines of defenders.
You were discovered before you could poison the water. Now you will have to flee, making your way through the lines of defenders.
You managed to plow through the guard lines and escape the town.
You managed to hide in the maze of streets and escape the town.
You managed to sneak into the city, but part of your army remains outside the walls. You shall need to defeat no less than {reg0}% of defenders before you can open the gates.
You failed to sneak into the city. Worse yet, your vanguard ({s50}) was slaughtered by the city defenders, and the morale of your main forces has fallen.
You have counted that you shall need no less than {reg4} hours to plant the explosives.
You failed to plant the explosives. Apparently, you overestimated your knowledge of such arts.
The walls of this city are too strong to be broken by such means.
The explosives detonated, destroying part of the wall...
The walls of this city are too strong to be broken by such means.
You arrived in time! The bandits have not yet plundered the village. However, they noticed your arrival and are preparing to attack.
Before the old man could finish his speech, one of the wounded bandits took a shot. Alas, the bullet found its mark... The old man can tell you nothing more.

To the secret service clerk, to be delivered in person. ^^Acting on your orders, I discovered that the graves of the house of Oleg were stolen from Kiev by the Lithuanian Prince Janusz Radziwill. Word as it that he has taken them to his family burial vault. So far I know nothing more. One thing is certain, however -- Radziwill is a Protestant heretic, even ready to perform witchcraft if it will bring him closer to the crown. ^I send this message with a trusty spy, may God keep him safe, while I go to Riga where the archives of the Templars may hold the secret of the Black Mace...
Leave the harem and go to the city.
You challenge one of the pub's patrons to a fight. Your enemy is ready and awaits you.
A bad joke leads you straight into a fight. This would be a good time to recall your fencing practice, and give your foe a good dressing down.
You prepare for a marksmanship contest. To win, you must hit as many targets as you can.
That last cup of wine turns out to be not such a good idea and you drift off to a drunken stupor. When you open up your eyes, you find yourself in a dark cell in the city prison.
You wake up the devil knows where, beaten and penniless. You vaguely recall your last toast...
You have become too fond of pubs. Not a day passes by without you draining a couple mugs. But once you do, your strength fails you, and your money strangely vanishes...
Low spirits among your troops led to a riot. The rebellious demand your blood -- or gold -- "for their labors".
{s0} Men of wisdom say good food can help. Perhaps, {s1} or {s2} might heal the soldiers. In any case, a small rest in a pub could do no harm.
Thanks to a good rest and some decent food, your soldiers have recovered from {s0}.

Your soldiers growl at you with unceasing hunger. They grow tired of these constant marches. Displeasure spreads among your men. ^^Even your weathered fighters hint that it would be well to spend a day or two at the nearest inn...
Rumors spread that Ataman Stenka Razin has stirred up another rebellion. This time -- against you.
You persuaded the Boyars to support you in the election. As a result, you have become Tsar.
You failed to draw the Boyars to your side. The Boyar Council elected Razin as Tsar.
With which nation do you wish to declare war?
You really wish to start a war with {s2}?
During the siege, {s2} of {s3} has lost {s50} in traps.
{s2} was made in {s1} on your order. You may collect it.
Take a loan for one month with {reg0}%.
Select a sum {s0}. Currently the sum {s0} is equal to {reg5}.
Do you wish to carry out this transaction?
You do not have enough money for that!
You have not returned the monies due in time, so the bankers have decided to collect by force.
Now the ambassadors can always be found in {s1}.
Here you can talk to the garrison commander and hire forces.
All the caravan goods have been sold. After calculating all your expenses, you count a profit of {reg1} thaler.
After spending 25 thaler on a satisfying meal, you decide to have a rest.
